award_name.ja: 日本膜構造協会 研究論文特別賞

paper_title.en: A new proportioning method for member sections of single layer reticulated domes subjected to uniform and non-uniform loads

description.en: This paper presents a new proportioning method for member sections of single layer reticulated domes based on linear buckling stress obtained from linear buckling analysis using geometric stiffness matrices. This method includes elasto-plastic behaviors and instability of the members and the global shell buckling. To confirm the validity of this method, firstly roller supported single layer reticulated domes subjected to uniform load are designed by the method and then it is discussed how the domes satisfy the required load conditions, and lastly it is verified by the inelastic buckling analysis. Also the buckling load and strength of single layer reticulated domes under non-uniform loads are presented with emphasis on how to apply the buckling axial stress expressed by the generalized slenderness ratio of members. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: ラチスドームのPush-over analysisに基づく地震応答推定に関する一考察、2つのモードが支配的な空間構造物に対する検討
paper_title.en: A STUDY ON SEISMIC RESPONSE ESTIMATION BASED ON PUSH-OVER ANALYSIS APPLIED TO RETICULAR DOMES : Investigation in case of domes with two predominant vibration modes

description.ja: The present paper discusses and proposes the estimation method of the dynamic response of a reticular dome supported by a sub-structure based on push-over analysis considering the effects of the second mode. The investigation shows that in most cases of ordinary reticular domes the sum of the effective masses for the first and second mode is greater than 90% of the total mass even if the effective mass for the first is as small as 30% of the total mass. Under such condition of small effective mass of the first mode the accuracy of the estimation is investigated through comparison between those based the present estimation and the results based on direct dynamic nonlinear response analysis, leading to a conclusion that the present estimation method is fur efficient than that previously proposed by the same authors neglecting the contribution from the second mode.
description.en: The present paper discusses and proposes the estimation method of the dynamic response of a reticular dome supported by a sub-structure based on push-over analysis considering the effects of the second mode. The investigation shows that in most cases of ordinary reticular domes the sum of the effective masses for the first and second mode is greater than 90% of the total mass even if the effective mass for the first is as small as 30% of the total mass. Under such condition of small effective mass of the first mode the accuracy of the estimation is investigated through comparison between those based the present estimation and the results based on direct dynamic nonlinear response analysis, leading to a conclusion that the present estimation method is fur efficient than that previously proposed by the same authors neglecting the contribution from the second mode.

paper_title.ja: ラチスドームのPush-over snalysisに基づく地震応答推定に関する一考察 一次モード支配型の空間構造物に対する検討
paper_title.en: A STUDY ON SEISMIC RESPONSE ESTIMATION BASED ON PUSH-OVER ANALYSIS APPLIED TO RETICULAR DOMES : Investigation in case of domes with one predominant vibration mode

description.ja: This paper discusses on the earthquake response estimation of reticular domes supported by a sub-structure based on a push-over analysis. First, domes are represented as a series of parallel lumped masses, which can be easily modeled based on a mode decomposition concept. Second, a push-over analysis is formulated for the lumped masses including the dome and the substructure. The investigation about the accuracy of the push-over analysis follows a series of time-domain dynamic responses including plastic deformation of the substructure. Finally the restriction of the applicability is confirmed from the comparison between the push-over analyses and the time-domain nonlinear analyses, and a simple condition is found that the equivalent mass ratio of the first mode should be greater than 0.80 otherwise the dome responses would be poorly estimated.
description.en: This paper discusses on the earthquake response estimation of reticular domes supported by a sub-structure based on a push-over analysis. First, domes are represented as a series of parallel lumped masses, which can be easily modeled based on a mode decomposition concept. Second, a push-over analysis is formulated for the lumped masses including the dome and the substructure. The investigation about the accuracy of the push-over analysis follows a series of time-domain dynamic responses including plastic deformation of the substructure. Finally the restriction of the applicability is confirmed from the comparison between the push-over analyses and the time-domain nonlinear analyses, and a simple condition is found that the equivalent mass ratio of the first mode should be greater than 0.80 otherwise the dome responses would be poorly estimated.

paper_title.en: BUCKLING BEHAVIORS AND STRENGTH ESTIMATION OF SINGLE LAYER HP LATTICE SHELLS

description.ja: The purpose of the paper is to discuss the buckling behavior of rigidly jointed shallow HP (hyperbolic paraboloidal) . Lattice shell under uniform lateral loading and to propose a concept of column buckling strength by. Which the buckling loads are effectively expressed. First, a series of eigenvalue analysis is carried out to obtain the linear buckling loads depending on the several parameters, based on which a generalized slenderness is defined for column buckling curve, then followed by both the elastic and the elasto-plastic buckling analysis to find the magnitude of the knock down factor and the column strength for HP lattice. Finally the initial yield load and the ultimate load are expressed in terms of column buckling strength, and the concept is applied to estimate the initial yield load and the ultimate load based of HP lattice shells.
description.en: The purpose of the paper is to discuss the buckling behavior of rigidly jointed shallow HP (hyperbolic paraboloidal) . Lattice shell under uniform lateral loading and to propose a concept of column buckling strength by. Which the buckling loads are effectively expressed. First, a series of eigenvalue analysis is carried out to obtain the linear buckling loads depending on the several parameters, based on which a generalized slenderness is defined for column buckling curve, then followed by both the elastic and the elasto-plastic buckling analysis to find the magnitude of the knock down factor and the column strength for HP lattice. Finally the initial yield load and the ultimate load are expressed in terms of column buckling strength, and the concept is applied to estimate the initial yield load and the ultimate load based of HP lattice shells.

paper_title.ja: 偏載荷重を受ける単層ラチスドームの座屈応力度と座屈荷重に関する研究
paper_title.en: BUCKLING STRESS AND BUCKLING LOAD OF SINGLE LAYER RETICULATED DOMES UNDER NON-UNIFORM LOADINGS

description.ja: The authors presented a proportioning method for member sections of single layer reticulated domes in the previous papers based on a second-order elastic analysis. In the first part of the present paper, a method complementary to the above method is proposed based on linear buckling stress obtained from linear buckling analysis, being more familiar than the second-order elastic analysis. The proportioning method based on linear buckling stress is verified through elasto-plastic simulation for roller supported single layer reticulated dome. The second part of the present paper discusses buckling stresses and buckling loads of single layer reticulated domes under non-uniform loadings. The usefulness of this proportioning method under non-uniform loadings is discussed and verified through elasto-plastic simulation for roller supported single layer reticulated domes.
description.en: The authors presented a proportioning method for member sections of single layer reticulated domes in the previous papers based on a second-order elastic analysis. In the first part of the present paper, a method complementary to the above method is proposed based on linear buckling stress obtained from linear buckling analysis, being more familiar than the second-order elastic analysis. The proportioning method based on linear buckling stress is verified through elasto-plastic simulation for roller supported single layer reticulated dome. The second part of the present paper discusses buckling stresses and buckling loads of single layer reticulated domes under non-uniform loadings. The usefulness of this proportioning method under non-uniform loadings is discussed and verified through elasto-plastic simulation for roller supported single layer reticulated domes.
